content: Hello! Thank you for contacting XYZ Home Services. How can I help you today? Are you looking for assistance with electrical, plumbing, or HVAC services?
Yeah, I need someone to look at some outlets that stopped working. But I’m not gonna get ripped off here, alright?
Absolutely, I’ll make sure you know the costs up front. May I have your name to get started?
It’s Mike. Again though, I don’t want any funny business with surprise charges. What’s it gonna cost me to fix a few outlets?
Thank you, Mike. I’ll give you an estimate. First, could you please provide your address so I can verify you’re in our service area?
72 Marigold Lane. But you’re dodging my question. How much? I don’t want you coming out here and slapping me with a bill for something I didn’t ask for.

Thank you, Mike. We operate at 72 Marigold Lane, so you’re in our service area. Pricing can depend on the issue, but I can get you an estimate or let you know if an on-site evaluation is required. Would you like me to get you a rough price estimate for checking and repairing a few outlets?
What do you mean 'depends on the issue'? What if it takes 10 minutes, do I get charged the same as if you’re here all day? Why can’t you just give me a number like a normal business?

I understand your concern. We want you to feel comfortable. Most service calls have a base rate, and additional costs depend on the extent of repairs. Would you like a price estimate for an average outlet repair, or do you prefer a technician to explain everything when they arrive?
Just say the number! How much is this base rate? Don’t give me the runaround. If this is some $200 ‘just to show up’ nonsense, I’m not interested.

Our standard service call fee is $89, which covers the technician coming to your home and diagnosing the issue. Most standard outlet repairs can be completed for around $120–$180, including parts and labor. You will be informed of any charges before work begins. Does that help clarify?
So the guy might show up, tell me it’s $89 just for knocking, then say it’s another $180 to do anything? You see what I’m saying here? This stuff is why people hate dealing with contractors.

I get it, Mike. With us, you're always told the price up front—no hidden fees, no surprise costs. The $89 is for the visit and diagnosis. If repairs are needed, we’ll give you a full quote before starting anything. You can always decline if you’re not comfortable with it.
Still sounds like a scam to me. The last guy said $60, now you’re telling me $89 just to ring the bell. Why do you have to charge that much? The markup must be ridiculous.

I completely understand your hesitation, Mike. Our rates cover licensed, insured professionals and quality materials with a full guarantee on all work—we strive for transparency and fairness. If you’d like to compare, feel free to shop around! If you decide to book, I’m here to help you schedule.
I don’t need a sales pitch. Just book it, but if I feel like I get upsold on anything, I’m gonna post about it everywhere. What times do you have?
Thank you, Mike. When would you prefer the technician to come by? We have appointments available this afternoon or tomorrow, whichever suits you best.
Sooner is better. Today after 2pm. And that’s it—no hidden anything.
Understood. I’ll check availability for today after 2pm at 72 Marigold Lane and confirm your appointment now.

Your appointment is confirmed for today after 2pm. You’ll get a reminder shortly. Please let us know if anything changes—our technician will explain all costs before starting any work. Thank you, Mike!
